intro: Semenovia malcolmii, commonly known as the Malcolm's daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming from late winter to early spring. It has silver-green foliage with a fuzzy texture, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Semenovia malcolmii is often cultivated in rock gardens and dry landscapes due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
